com.nodrex.datamatrix

Interface IDataMatrix<Data>

  • All Superinterfaces:
    java.lang.Cloneable, java.lang.Comparable<IDataMatrix<Data>>, java.io.Serializable
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    DataMatrix, Matrix

    public interface IDataMatrix<Data>
extends java.lang.Cloneable, java.lang.Comparable<IDataMatrix<Data>>, java.io.Serializable

    This interface contains useful methods which are implemented in DataMatrix class.

    Implements Serializable , Comparable , Cloneable interfaces.

    Can be implemented by any class or extended by any class.

    Since:
    2013
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    NODREX

    • Method Detail

      • addColumn

        void addColumn()
        Adds new column in to the end of this matrix.

      • addColumn

        void addColumn(Data... columnArray)
        Adds new column in to the end of this matrix and copy values from given columnArray to newly created column.

        If columnArray length is bigger then this matrix column dimension than copied will be only column dimension number of data, other data will be ignored.

        If columnArray length is less then this matrix column dimension than copied will be all columnArray and other places of this column will be null.

        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if given lineArray is null.

      • addColumn

        void addColumn(Data defaultvalue)
        Adds new column in to the end of this matrix and fills with default value.

      • addColumn

        void addColumn(java.util.List<Data> columnList)
        Adds new column in to the end of this matrix and copy values from given columnList to newly created column.

        If columnList size is bigger then this matrix column dimension than copied will be only column dimension number of data, other data will be ignored.

        If columnList size is less then this matrix column dimension than copied will be all columnList and other places of this column will be null.

        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if given columnList is null.

      • addLine

        void addLine()
        Adds new line in to the end of this matrix.

      • addLine

        void addLine(Data... lineArray)
        Adds new line in to the end of this matrix and copy values from given lineArray to newly created row.

        If lineArray length is bigger then this matrix line dimension than copied will be only line dimension number of data, other data will be ignored.

        If lineArray length is less then this matrix line dimension than copied will be all lineArray and other places of this line will be null.

        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if given lineArray is null

      • addLine

        void addLine(Data defaultvalue)
        Adds new line in to the end of this matrix and fills with default value.

      • addLine

        void addLine(java.util.List<Data> lineList)
        Adds new line in to the end of this matrix and copy values from given lineList to newly created row.

        If lineList size is bigger then this matrix line dimension than copied will be only line dimension number of data, other data will be ignored.

        If lineList size is less then this matrix line dimension than copied will be all lineList and other places of this line will be null.

        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if given lineArray is null

      • addMatrixAtLine

        void addMatrixAtLine(IDataMatrix<Data> matrix)
        Adds new matrix to the end of this matrix. Both matrix values will be copied and column dimension of this new matrix will be same , but line dimension will be changed : this.linedimension + matrix.linedimension.

        For example:

        this matrix:

        1,2,3

        Second matrix:

        4,5,6

        After this method matrix will be 2 X 3

        1,2,3
        4,5,6

        If there will be some incompatible dimensions than matrix will be resized automatically, so there may be some new values as null or less values if matrix column dimension is bigger then this matrix column dimension.

        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if matrix is null.

      • addMatrixAtLine

        void addMatrixAtLine(IDataMatrix<Data> matrix,
                   Data defaultValue)
        Adds new matrix to the end of this matrix. Both matrix values will be copied and column dimension of this new matrix will be same , but line dimension will be changed : this.linedimension + matrix.linedimension.

        For example:

        this matrix:

        1,2,3

        Second matrix:

        4,5,6

        After this method matrix will be 2 X 3

        1,2,3
        4,5,6

        If there will be some incompatible dimensions than matrix will be resized automatically, so there may be some new values filled with defaultValue or less values if matrix column dimension is bigger then this matrix column dimension.

        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if matrix is null.

      • addMatrixAtcolumn

        void addMatrixAtcolumn(IDataMatrix<Data> matrix)
        Adds new matrix at the las column of this matrix. Both matrix values will be copied and line dimension of this new matrix will be same , but column dimension will be changed : this.columndimension + matrix.columndimension.

        For example:

        this matrix:

        1,2,3

        Second matrix:

        4,5,6

        After this method matrix will be 1 X 6

        1,2,3,4,5,6

        If there will be some incompatible dimensions than matrix will be resized automatically, so there may be some new values as null or less values if matrix line dimension is bigger then this matrix line dimension.

        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if matrix is null.

      • addMatrixAtcolumn

        void addMatrixAtcolumn(IDataMatrix<Data> matrix,
                     Data defaultValue)
        Adds new matrix at the las column of this matrix. Both matrix values will be copied and line dimension of this new matrix will be same , but column dimension will be changed : this.columndimension + matrix.columndimension.

        For example:

        this matrix:

        1,2,3

        Second matrix:

        4,5,6

        After this method matrix will be 1 X 6

        1,2,3,4,5,6

        If there will be some incompatible dimensions than matrix will be resized automatically, so there may be some new values filled with defaultValue or less values if matrix line dimension is bigger then this matrix line dimension.

        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if matrix is null.

      • changeContent

        void changeContent(Data[][] data,
                 java.lang.String name,
                 java.lang.String id)
        Parameters:
        data - : Changes whole data of this matrix and dimensions automatically.

        You also can gave jagged data, it will automatically fit dimensions: It will take max line and column dimensions.

        name - : Changes name of this data matrix.
        id - : Changes id of this data matrix.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if given data or name is null.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if id is not unique and this kind of id already exists or id is null or empty.

      • changeContent

        void changeContent(java.util.List<java.util.List<Data>> data,
                 java.lang.String name,
                 java.lang.String id)
        Parameters:
        data - : Changes whole data of this matrix and dimensions automatically.

        You also can gave jagged data, it will automatically fit dimensions: It will take max line and column dimensions.

        name - : Changes name of this data matrix.
        id - : Changes id of this data matrix.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if given data or name is null.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if data is not filled at least with one element or if id is not unique and this kind of id already exists or id is null or empty.

      • copy

        void copy(java.util.List<java.util.List<Data>> data)
        Copy values from given data.

        This method makes auto correction of dimensions .

        You also can gave jagged data, it will automatically fit dimensions: It will take max line and column dimensions.

        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if given data will be null
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if data is not filled at least with one element.

      • getDiagonal

        java.util.List<Data> getDiagonal(int index)
        Returns:
        diagonal on given place (index). If index is 0 then it will return main diagonal, if index is more than 0 it returns up diagonal , if index is less then 0 it returns down diagonal.
        Throws:
        java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - if index is not in matrix diagonal dimension range.

      • getDiagonal2

        java.util.List<Data> getDiagonal2(int index)
        Returns:
        diagonal on given place (index) from right to left direction. If index is 0 then it will return main diagonal, if index is more than 0 it returns up diagonal , if index is less then 0 it returns down diagonal.
        Throws:
        java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - if index is not in matrix diagonal dimension range.

      • getFirstNotNullValue

        Data getFirstNotNullValue()
        Returns:
        first value form this matrix which is not null.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if all values in this matrix are null.

      • getId

        java.lang.String getId()
        Returns:
        id of this matrix.

      • getIndexesOf

        int[] getIndexesOf(Data value)
        Returns:
        indexes of the given value, if data matrix contains this value.

        First value of returned array contains line index and second value contains column index.

        If data matrix does not contains given value returns null.

        If there is many values like given value, it will return indexes of first matched value.

      • getIndexesOfEmptyPlaces

        java.util.List<java.util.List<java.lang.Integer>> getIndexesOfEmptyPlaces()
        Returns:
        indexes of empty places (place which contains null).

        GetIndexesOfEmptyPlaces.get(0) returns list of line indexes

        GetIndexesOfEmptyPlaces.get(1) returns list of column indexes

      • getIndexesOfMaxValue

        int[] getIndexesOfMaxValue()
        Returns:
        indexes of maximum value of this matrix. Comparable should be implemented by data which is stored in this matrix.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if this matrix contains even one null.
        java.lang.ClassCastException - if stored data does not implements Comparable interface.

      • getIndexesOfMaxValue

        int[] getIndexesOfMaxValue(java.util.Comparator<Data> comparator)
        Returns:
        indexes of maximum value of this matrix.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if this matrix contains even one null or given comparator is null.

      • insertColumn

        void insertColumn(int index)
        Inserts column in any places that you want.

        Given index can be negative and it will add column at the head of this matrix.

        If index will be out of the range of dimension this method will resize matrix automatically.

      • insertColumn

        void insertColumn(int index,
                Data defaultValue)
        Inserts column in any places that you want and fill with default value.

        Given index can be negative and it will add column at the head of this matrix.

        If index will be out of the range of dimension this method will resize matrix automatically.

        Fills all newly created empty places.

      • insertColumn

        void insertColumn(int index,
                Data... columnArray)
        Inserts column in any places that you want and copy values from given columnArray to newly created column.

        Given index can be negative and it will add column at the head of this matrix.

        If columnArray length is bigger then this matrix column dimension than copied will be only column dimension number of data, other data will be ignored.

        If columnArray length is less then this matrix column dimension than copied will be all columnArray and other places of this line will be null.

        Fills all newly created empty places.

        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if given columnArray is null.

      • insertColumn

        void insertColumn(int index,
                java.util.List<Data> columnList)
        Inserts column in any places that you want and copy values from given columnList to newly created column.

        Given index can be negative and it will add line at the head of this matrix.

        If columnList size is bigger then this matrix column dimension than copied will be only column dimension number of data, other data will be ignored.

        If columnList size is less then this matrix column dimension than copied will be all columnList and other places of this column will be null.

        Fills all newly created empty places.

        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if given columnList is null.

      • insertData

        void insertData(int lineIndex,
              int columnIndex,
              Data[]... data)
        Inserts given data in this matrix in the given place (lineIndex) , (columnIndex). If dimensions will not be in range this method will automatically resize this matrix.

        For example:
        DataMatrix dm = new DataMatrix<>(3, new Integer(0));
        dm.insertData(1, 1, new Integer[]{1,1},new Integer[]{1,1});
        Result:
        Dimensions: 5 X 5
        0 null null 0 0
        null 1 1 null null
        null 1 1 null null
        0 null null 0 0
        0 null null 0 0

        Example 2:
        dm.insertData(0, 4, new Integer[]{1,1},new Integer[]{1,1});
        Result:
        Dimensions: 3 X 6
        0 0 0 null 1 1
        0 0 0 null 1 1
        0 0 0 null null null

        Example 3:
        dm.insertData(4, 0, new Integer[]{1,1},new Integer[]{1,1});
        Dimensions: 6 X 3
        0 0 0
        0 0 0
        0 0 0
        null null null
        1 1 null
        1 1 null

        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if indexes are negative.
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if given data is null.

      • insertData

        void insertData(int lineIndex,
              int columnIndex,
              java.util.List<java.util.List<Data>> data)
        Inserts given data in this matrix in the given place (lineIndex) , (columnIndex).If dimensions will not be in range this method will automatically resize this matrix.

        For example:
        DataMatrix dm = new DataMatrix<>(3, new Integer(0));
        List> data = new ArrayList<>();
        List innerData = new ArrayList<>();
        innerData.add(1);
        innerData.add(1);
        data.add(innerData);
        data.add(innerData);
        dm.insertData(1, 1, data);

        Result:
        Dimensions: 5 X 5
        0 null null 0 0
        null 1 1 null null
        null 1 1 null null
        0 null null 0 0
        0 null null 0 0

        Example 2:
        dm.insertData(0, 4, data);
        Result:
        Dimensions: 3 X 6
        0 0 0 null 1 1
        0 0 0 null 1 1
        0 0 0 null null null

        Example 3:
        dm.insertData(4, 0, data);
        Dimensions: 6 X 3
        0 0 0
        0 0 0
        0 0 0
        null null null
        1 1 null
        1 1 null

        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if indexes are negative.
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if given data is null.

      • insertElement

        void insertElement(int lineIndex,
                 int columnIndex,
                 Data value)
        Inserts given value in any place that you want.

        If dimensions will be out of matrix dimensions range this method will resize matrix automatically (first will be add line then column).

        Absolute value is taken from line and column indexes: lineIndex = Math.abs(lineIndex) and columnINdex= Math.abs(columnIndex)

      • insertElement

        void insertElement(int lineIndex,
                 int columnIndex,
                 Data value,
                 Data defaultValue)
        Inserts given value in any place that you want.

        If dimensions will be out of matrix dimensions range this method will resize this matrix automatically (first will be add line then column) and fills newly created line(s) and column(s) with default value.

        Absolute value is taken from line and column indexes: lineIndex = Math.abs(lineIndex) and columnINdex= Math.abs(columnIndex)

      • insertElement

        void insertElement(int lineIndex,
                 int columnIndex,
                 Data value,
                 Data[] lineArray,
                 Data[] columnArray)
        Inserts given value in any place that you want.

        If dimensions will be out of matrix dimensions range this method will resize this matrix automatically (first will be add line then column) and fills newly created line(s) and column(s) with values from lineArray and columnArray.

        Absolute value is taken from line and column indexes: lineIndex = Math.abs(lineIndex) and columnINdex= Math.abs(columnIndex)

        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if given lineArray or columnArray or both is null.

      • insertElement

        void insertElement(int lineIndex,
                 int columnIndex,
                 Data value,
                 java.util.List<Data> lineList,
                 java.util.List<Data> columnList)
        Inserts given value in any place that you want.

        If dimensions will be out of matrix dimensions range this method will resize this matrix automatically (first will be add line then column) and fills newly created line(s) and column(s) with values from lineList and columnList.

        Absolute value is taken from line and column indexes: lineIndex = Math.abs(lineIndex) and columnINdex= Math.abs(columnIndex)

        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if given lineList or columnList or both is null.

        If lineArray length is bigger then this matrix line dimension than copied will be only line dimension number of data, other data will be ignored.

        If lineArray length is less then this matrix line dimension than copied will be all lineArray and other places of this line will be null.

      • insertLine

        void insertLine(int index,
              java.util.List<Data> lineList)

        Given index can be negative and it will add line at the head of this matrix.

        If lineList size is bigger then this matrix line dimension than copied will be only line dimension number of data, other data will be ignored.

      • insertMatrix

        void insertMatrix(int lineIndex,
                int columnIndex,
                IDataMatrix<Data> matrix)
        Inserts given matrix in this matrix in the given place (lineIndex) , (columnIndex). If dimensions will not be in range this method will automatically resize this matrix.

        For example:
        DataMatrix dm = new DataMatrix<>(3, new Integer(0));
        dm.insertMatrix(1, 1, new DataMatrix(2, new Integer(1)));
        Result:
        Dimensions: 5 X 5
        0 null null 0 0
        null 1 1 null null
        null 1 1 null null
        0 null null 0 0
        0 null null 0 0

        Example 2:
        dm.insertMatrix(0, 4, new DataMatrix(2, new Integer(1)));
        Result:
        Dimensions: 3 X 6
        0 0 0 null 1 1
        0 0 0 null 1 1
        0 0 0 null null null

        Example 3:
        dm.insertMatrix(4, 0, new DataMatrix(2, new Integer(1)));
        Dimensions: 6 X 3
        0 0 0
        0 0 0
        0 0 0
        null null null
        1 1 null
        1 1 null

        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if indexes are negative.
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if given matrix is null.

      • is

        boolean is(Data value)
        Equals method should be override , otherwise equaled will be only reference.
        Parameters:
        value - that should be checked if exist in this matrix.
        Returns:
        true if data matrix contains given value, otherwise returns false.

        Returns:
        true if given column index is in range [ 0 , columnDimension ] otherwise returns false.

        Returns:
        true if matrix have only one column and many lines , otherwise returns false.

      • isDimensionsEqualTo

        boolean isDimensionsEqualTo(int lineDimension,
                          int columnDimension)
        Returns:
        true if matrix dimensions are equal to given dimensions:

        lineDimension should be equal to this matrix line dimension and columnDimension should be equal to this matrix column dimension , otherwise returns false.

      • isEveryElementEqualTo

        boolean isEveryElementEqualTo(Data variable)
        Returns:
        true if every element in this data matrix equals to given parameter (variable) , otherwise returns false.

        Equals method should be override , otherwise equaled will be only reference.

      • isEveryElementNotEqualTo

        boolean isEveryElementNotEqualTo(Data variable)
        Returns:
        true if in this matrix does not exists data like given parameter (variable) , otherwise returns false.

        Equals method should be override , otherwise equaled will be only reference.

      • isIndexes

                int columnIndex)
        Returns:
        true if given line index is in range [ 0 , lineDimension ] and column index is in range [ 0 , columnDimension ] otherwise returns false.

        Returns:
        true if given line index is in range [ 0 , lineDimension ] otherwise returns false.

      • isMatrix

        boolean isMatrix()
        Returns:
        true if matrix have many lines and columns (lineDimension > 1 && columnDimension > 1) , otherwise returns false.

      • isNull

        boolean isNull()
        Returns:
        true if this matrix contains even one null, otherwise returns false.

      • isRectangular

        boolean isRectangular()
        Returns:
        true if matrix dimensions are not equal, otherwise returns false.

      • isScalar

        boolean isScalar()
        Returns:
        true if matrix contains only one data (dimensions are: 1x1), otherwise returns false.

      • isSquare

        boolean isSquare()
        Returns:
        true if matrix dimensions are equal, otherwise returns false.

      • isVector

        boolean isVector()
        Returns:
        true if matrix have only one line and many columns, otherwise returns false.

      • joinMatrixAtColumn

        DataMatrix<Data> joinMatrixAtColumn(IDataMatrix<Data> matrix)
        Returns:
        new matrix with dimensions this.columnDimension + matrix.columnDimension X max(this.lineDimension, matrix.lineDimension). All data of this matrices will be in to this new matrix.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if matrix is null.

      • joinMatrixAtColumn

        DataMatrix<Data> joinMatrixAtColumn(IDataMatrix<Data> matrix,
                                  Data defaultValue)
        Returns:
        new matrix with dimensions this.columnDimension + matrix.columnDimension X max(this.lineDimension, matrix.lineDimension). All data of this matrices will be in to this new matrix and if there will be any empty place will fill with defaultValue.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if matrix is null.

      • joinMatrixAtLine

        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if matrix is null.

      • resize

        void resize(int lineDimension,
          int columnDimension)
        Resize matrix: Matrix can be decreased or increased, it depends on given dimensions.

        You can gave any dimensions if it would not be zero or negative!

        If in this matrix will be any data it also will be in resized matrix.

        if you want to decrease size of this matrix and there is some data, after resize data which will be out of the given dimensions will be lost.

        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if given dimensions are negative or zero.

      • resize

        void resize(int squareDimension)
        Resize matrix: Matrix can be decreased or increased, it depends on given dimensions.

        You can gave any dimension if it would not be zero or negative!

        If in this matrix will be any data it also will be in resized matrix.

        if you want to decrease size of this matrix and there is some data, after resize data which will be out of the given dimensions will be lost.

        After this resize you will get square matrix.

        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if given dimension is negative or zero.

      • resize

        void resize(int lineDimension,
          int columnDimension,
          Data defaultValue)
        Resize matrix: Matrix can be decreased or increased, it depends on given dimensions. Also fills new empty places with default value if you increase size and there will be empty places, otherwise it just ignores given default value.

        You can gave any dimensions if it would not be zero or negative!

        If in this matrix will be any data it also will be in resized matrix.

        if you want to decrease size of this matrix and there is some data, after resize data which will be out of the given dimensions will be lost.

        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if given dimensions are negative or zero.

      • resize

        void resize(int squareDimension,
          Data defaultValue)
        Resize matrix: Matrix can be decreased or increased, it depends on given dimensions. Also fills new empty places with default value if you increase size and there will be empty places, otherwise it just ignores given default value.

        You can gave any dimension if it would not be zero or negative!

        If in this matrix will be any data it also will be in resized matrix.

        if you want to decrease size of this matrix and there is some data, after resize data which will be out of the given dimensions will be lost.

        After this resize you will get square matrix.

        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if given dimension is negative or zero.

      • setColumn

        void setColumn(int columnIndex,
             Data... columnArray)
        Copy values from columnArray to given column (columnIndex).

        If columnArray length is bigger then this matrix column dimension than copied will be only column dimension number of data, other data will be ignored.

        If columnArray length is less then this matrix column dimension than copied will be all columnArray and other places of this line will be null.

        Throws:
        java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - if given columnIndex is out of this matrix column dimension range.
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if given columnArray is null.

      • setColumn

             java.util.List<Data> columnList)
        Copy values from columnList to given column (columnIndex).

        If columnList size is bigger then this matrix column dimension than copied will be only column dimension number of data, other data will be ignored.

        If columnList size is less then this matrix column dimension than copied will be all columnList and other places of this line will be null.

        Throws:
        java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - if given columnIndex is out of this matrix column dimension range.
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if given columnList is null.

      • setData

        void setData(Data[]... data)
        Stores data in to this data matrix and fills dimensions automatically.

        You also can gave jagged data, it will automatically fit dimensions: It will take max line and column dimensions.

        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if given data is null.

      • setData

        void setData(java.util.List<java.util.List<Data>> data)
        Stores data in to this data matrix and fills dimensions automatically.

        You also can gave jagged data, it will automatically fit dimensions: It will take max line and column dimensions.

        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if given data is null.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if data is not filled at least with one element.

      • setDiagonal

        void setDiagonal(int index,
               Data value)
        Fills diagonal on given place (index). If index is 0 then it will fill main diagonal, if index is more than 0 it fills up diagonal , if index is less then 0 it fills down diagonal.
        Throws:
        java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - if index is not in matrix diagonal dimension range.

      • setDiagonal2

        void setDiagonal2(int index,
                Data value)
        Fills diagonal on given place (index) from right to left direction. If index is 0 then it will fill main diagonal, if index is more than 0 it fills up diagonal , if index is less then 0 it fills down diagonal.
        Throws:
        java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - if index is not in matrix diagonal dimension range.

      • setId

        void setId(java.lang.String id)
        Sets id to this matrix.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if id is not unique and this kind of id already exists.

      • setLastElement

        void setLastElement(Data value)
        Sets value to the last element of this matrix.

      • setLine

        void setLine(int lineIndex,
           Data... lineArray)
        Copy values from lineArray to given line (lineIndex).

        If lineArray length is bigger then this matrix line dimension than copied will be only line dimension number of data, other data will be ignored.

        If lineArray length is less then this matrix line dimension than copied will be all lineArray and other places of this line will be null.

        Throws:
        java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - if given lineIndex is out of this matrix line dimension range.
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if given lineArray is null.

      • setLine

        void setLine(int lineIndex,
           java.util.List<Data> lineList)
        Copy values from lineList to given line (lineIndex).

        If lineList size is bigger then this matrix line dimension than copied will be only line dimension number of data, other data will be ignored.

        If lineList size is less then this matrix line dimension than copied will be all lineArray and other places of this line will be null.

        Throws:
        java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - if given lineIndex is out of this matrix line dimension range.
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if given lineList is null.

      • setLine

        void setLine(int lineIndex,
           Data value)
        Fills line on given place (index) with given value.
        Throws:
        java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - if given index is out of this matrix line dimension range.

      • setMainDiagonal

      • setMainDiagonal

        If diagonalArray length is bigger then this matrix diagonal dimension than copied will be only diagonal dimension number of data, other data will be ignored.

        If diagonalArray size is less then this matrix diagonal dimension than copied will be all diagonalArray and other places of this diagonal will be null.

        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if diagonalArray is null.

        If diagonalList size is less then this matrix diagonal dimension than copied will be all diagonalList and other places of this diagonal will be null.

        Throws:

        If diagonalArray length is less then this matrix diagonal dimension than copied will be all diagonalArray and other places of this diagonal will be null.

        Throws:

      • sortColumnAsc

        void sortColumnAsc(int index)
        Sorts this matrix column which locates on given index by ascending order. Comparable should be implemented by data which is stored in this matrix.
        Throws:
        java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - if index is out of this matrix dimension range.
        java.lang.NullPointerException
        java.lang.ClassCastException - if data witch is stored in this matrix does not implements Comparable interface.

      • sortColumn

              java.util.Comparator<Data> comparator)

        Throws:

        java.lang.NullPointerException

        Throws:

        java.lang.NullPointerException
        java.lang.ClassCastException - if data witch is stored in this matrix does not implements Comparable interface.

        Throws:

        java.lang.NullPointerException
        java.lang.ClassCastException - if data witch is stored in this matrix does not implements Comparable interface.

            java.util.Comparator<Data> comparator)

        Throws:

        java.lang.NullPointerException - if this matrix contains even one null or given comparator is null.

        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if this matrix contains even one null.
        java.lang.ClassCastException - if data witch is stored in this matrix does not implements Comparable interface.

                         int startColumnIndex,
                         int endLineIndex,
                         int endColumnIndex)

        sub matrix of this matrix.

      • swap

        void swap(IDataMatrix<Data> matrix)
        Swaps this matrixes, even name and id.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if given matrix is null.

      • swapColumns

        void swapColumns(int columnIndex_1,
               int columnIndex_2)
        Changes place of tow column witch are stored on given places.

        it means that column witch is stored in columnIndex_1 will stored in columnIndex_2 and column witch was stored in columnIndex_2 will stored in columnIndex_1.

        Throws:
        java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - if columnIndex_1 or columnIndex_2 or both are out of this matrix column dimension range.

      • swapData

        void swapData(IDataMatrix<Data> matrix)
        Changes data between given and this matrix.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if given matrix is null.

      • swapData

        void swapData(int lineIndex_1,
            int columnIndex_1,
            int lineIndex_2,
            int columnIndex_2)
        Changes places of tow data on given places.
        Throws:
        java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - if given indexes are out of this matrix dimensions range.

      • swapData

        void swapData(Data data_1,
            Data data_2)
        Changes places to given data_1 and data_2 if both of them exists in this matrix.

        Equals method should be override for given data parameters.

        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if this matrix do not contains any of this given data or both.
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if given data_1 or data_2 or both is null.

      • swapLines

        void swapLines(int lineIndex_1,
             int lineIndex_2)
        Changes place of tow line witch are stored on given places.

        it means that line witch is stored in lineIndex_1 will stored in lineIndex_2 and line witch was stored in lineIndex_2 will stored in lineIndex_1.

        Throws:
        java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - if lineIndex_1 or lineIndex_2 or both are out of this matrix line dimension range.

      • toList

        java.util.List<Data> toList()
        Returns:
        list from this matrix, it means that: All lines will be located side by side together in list started from first line.

      • toListByColumn

        java.util.List<Data> toListByColumn()
        Returns:
        list from this matrix, it means that: All columns will be located side by side together in list started from first column.

      • transpose

        DataMatrix<Data> transpose()
        Transpose this matrix.
        Returns:
        Transposed matrix

      • writeObject

        void writeObject(java.lang.String fileName)
                 throws java.io.FileNotFoundException,
                        java.io.IOException,
                        java.lang.NullPointerException,
                        java.io.NotSerializableException
        Writes data as DataMatrix in to given file. If data is not primitive than Serializable interface should be implemented by this data.
        Throws:
        FileNotFoundException - if given file does not exists.
        IOException - if there will be some problem with input.
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if given fileName is null or if every element is null.
        NotSerializableException - if stored data does not implements Serializable interface.

      • write

        void write(java.lang.String fileName)
           throws java.io.FileNotFoundException,
                  java.io.IOException,
                  java.lang.NullPointerException
        Writes data in to given file using toString method for data which is stored in this matrix.

        Uses one space to separate data.

        Throws:
        FileNotFoundException - if given file does not exists.
        IOException - if there will be some problem with input.
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if given fileName is null or if every element is null.

      • write

        void write(java.lang.String fileName,
         char separator)
           throws java.io.FileNotFoundException,
                  java.io.IOException,
                  java.lang.NullPointerException
        Writes data in to given file using toString method for data which is stored in this matrix.

        Data will be separated by given separator.

        Throws:
        FileNotFoundException - if given file does not exists.
        IOException - if there will be some problem with input.
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if given fileName is null or if every element is null.

      • write

        void write(java.lang.String fileName,
         boolean append)
           throws java.io.FileNotFoundException,
                  java.io.IOException,
                  java.lang.NullPointerException
        Writes data in to the end of the given file if append argument will be true. Using toString method for data which is stored in this matrix.

        Uses one space to separate data.

        Throws:
        FileNotFoundException - if given file does not exists.
        IOException - if there will be some problem with input.
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if given fileName is null or if every element is null.

      • write

         char separator,
         boolean append)
           throws java.io.FileNotFoundException,
                  java.io.IOException,
                  java.lang.NullPointerException

        Throws:
        FileNotFoundException - if given file does not exists.
        IOException - if there will be some problem with input.
